DataElement.preferredName: Post Procedure Analgesic Agent Recommendation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to advice of analgesic agent after procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to advice of analgesic agent after procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:Drugs that reduce pain. These drugs include aspirin, acetaminophen, and ibuprofen.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Compounds that alleviate pain without loss of consciousness.  Analgesics act by various mechanisms including binding with opioid receptors and decreasing inflammation.  Choice of analgesic may be determined by the type of pain.  These compounds include opioid, non-opioid and adjuvant analgesic agents.

Property.preferredDefinition: Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Concepts.definition: Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
